newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent gains on technicals, U.S. heating oil.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent gains on technicals, U.S. heating oil.

text.p: IPE Brent crude oil futures were stronger on Wednesday, underpinned by good technical support, and amid a perception that latest heating oil stocks data from key U.S. market were more bullish than had been anticipated.
March Brent was trading at $22.68 a barrel at 1526 GMT, 43 cents up. February gas oil was $2.75 a tonne up at $203.25.
"We have got to look at (NYMEX) heating oil and that is leading the way," one IPE floor trader said.
Latest data from the Americal Patroleum Institute (API) showed a weekly draw in U.S. heating oil inventories of 2.85 million barrels, slightly more than had been expected.
Traders said that March Brent's failure to break lower through the psychological level of $22.00 a barrel had encouraged the bulls.
This extra confidence, according to one trader, had led to covering of some short positions.
"Our perception is that there are still a few shorts in the market and this is being seen as an opportunity to neutralise the market a little."
A forecast of below-normal temperatures in the key heating oil markets in the northeastern U.S. was giving the market an added boost, he added.
